{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3306150,"name":"Rick F","username":"rickfmn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rickfmn/{size}/196033_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T02:35:25.280Z","cooked":"

We have implemented Yet Another Generic Swerve Library and it was working great. I am thinking this just occurred with the latest update (2024.4.8.2).

When the robot is stopped and a slow velocity is applied 90 degrees, only one or two wheels will rotate to the correct set point. If any rotation is added it will immediately work correctly.

Attached below is the FRC Web Components view of this happening. Look at the wheel on the bottom right, it correctly turns when the robot is requested to slowly move left when the wheels are currently set to forward back. At the end of the video I slowly rotate the bot and all wheels immediately correct course.

Any ideas on what could be the problem? Some deadband? PID?

That would be the SwerveMath.antiJitter function. The idea is if the speed is less than 1% i think it will not move, or something like that

github.com

BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example/blob/dev/src/main/java/swervelib/SwerveModule.java#L240-L245


      
    
          
  1. // If we are forcing the angle
    2. 
          
  2. if (!force)
    3. 
          
  3. {
    4. 
          
  4.   // Prevents module rotation if speed is less than 1%
    5. 
          
  5.   SwerveMath.antiJitter(desiredState, lastState, Math.min(maxSpeed, 4));
    6. 
          
  6. }
    7.

That would be the SwerveMath.antiJitter function. The idea is if the speed is less than 1% i think it will not move, or something like that

What is the easiest way to disable this? I do not see a configuration controlling the force boolean in the swerve configs. Do we increase the maxspeed? Or is there a config option to set force to false upstream someplace?

We see this happening quite a bit, even at moderate speeds if the new angle is >60 degrees, one or two of the swerve modules stay incorrectly turned.

However as stated, if the same slow velocity is combined with a slow rotation all modules turn correctly.

rickfmn:

we increase the maxspeed

Yes, if this is happening alot you probably have the wrong max speed. You can copy the source and disable it directly it you want though. The force option is not meant for team use. I honestly never thought this issue would occur. There is an outstanding task for me to make this an optional setting which i will move up in my priorities now.

Easiest thing to do is to copy the source of YAGSL (preferably from here) then comment out this section of code until i make that update.

YAGSL-Example/src/main/java/swervelib/SwerveModule.java at dev · BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example · GitHub

Did you check your deadbands?

I do not think that is the problem.
Any time the wheels need to rotate close to ninety only one or two even get commanded to rotate or move. Even at about half max velocity commanded.

Anything around 45 always works. And any z rotation included with a small x or y will command all wheels correctly.

I will try to get a video from the web components that shows that only one or two wheels get a large velocity command while the other two or three get nothing for a period of time.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-02-10T15:44:43.272Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":58.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":454132,"topic_slug":"yagsl-wheels-do-not-rotate-60-at-same-time","display_username":"Rick F","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59719,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-wheels-do-not-rotate-60-at-same-time/454132/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3306463,"name":"Mihir","username":"Flint221","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T18:48:34.967Z","cooked":"

Hey! This is coming from a team that nstrike mentors. I think I know how to remedy your problem. Just to make it clear the problem you are having is that your left stick translation whenever put close you any 90 degree angle (ex. 0, 90, 180, 270) will cause all of the modules to snap to that position even when your controller joystick is at a different position, but it works well when around the 45 degree mark. In the graphic below if the joystick is in any of the orange positions the modules snap to the green positions.

image720×651 57.8 KB

Possible Solution:
First check your deadband, from personal experience i recommend you setting this to 0.1 or 0.05 (nothing lower for now). Then head over to your swerve subsystem. I am going to be using line numbers from the YAGSL example subsystem. Anywhere where input in being taken and cubed, we need to remove (path.pow) where the inputs are trying to be “smoothed out”. (FYI Do not take out math.pow from Angular rotation!)

In YAGSL’s example project;
In lines 201 & 202

image881×121 10 KB

In lines 273 & 274 (Leave 275 Alone)

image915×142 9.79 KB

Lines 426 & 427

image793×139 5.36 KB

Lines 447 & 448

Leave the angular rotation alone in all of these examples. If you aren’t using the YAGL Swerve Example project subsystem, search through your code and find out where all of translation 2d and x/y inputs are being cubed and removed the power. Please let me know if this fixes the issue. Beware this may make your robot very sensitive to inputs!. Hope this helps!
